pageContext.description: Dimensions:EL 57.5mm; We 16mm; Ds29mm; Wt. 36.1 gms,Typology: probably a near-square section; no m-m's survive,Manufacture: hints of casting flash in differential corrosion,Condition: cutting edge blunt,Attached Material:traces of soil in socket end.
pageContext.surface: Very pocked scarred, no sign of original surface.
pageContext.collection: Crisp, Mr. Glen - private (1991),The Willows, Drym, Praze, Cornwall,TR14 0NU
pageContext.site: England,Cornwall,St. Erth,Bosence,Found 1 December 1990 by Glen Crisp using a metal-detector; 4 inches deep in a field at SW 572 322; the only metal object found in the field.
pageContext.toSearch: St Erth, Hayle, Cornwall Tr27, UK
